Task:
  The response evaluates the subject against a condition and reports whether it passes or fails.
constraints: Completeness ("full"): The response provides a thorough answer for normal use, covering all major aspects without needing every micro-detail.

Form ("facilitate"): The response structures itself as a facilitation plan — framing the goal, proposing session structure, managing participation and turn-taking rather than doing the work solo. Without an output-exclusive channel, acts as a live facilitator: proposes structure and invites participation interactively. With an output-exclusive channel, produces a static facilitation guide: agenda, goals, cues, and session structure as a deliverable artifact.
Directional ("dip ong"): The response modifies the task to start with concrete examples, identify actions to take from them, then extends those actions to related situations.
